p: A novel alphamesonivirus, Odorna virus (OdV), and the previously reported Cavally virus (CAVV) were detected in 2016 and 2015, respectively, in the Greater Accra region. OdV was detected in only male Aedes aegypti mosquitoes, whereas CAVV was detected in both sexes of Culex and Aedes aegypti mosquitoes ( Table 1). Both viruses belong to the genus Alphamesonivirus-1 with a ribosomal frameshift (RFS) between ORF 1a and 1b ( Figure 5). The conserved slippery sequence GGAUUUU was found in the ORF 1a/1b overlap region [ 33]. This RFS facilitates the expression of ORF 1b [ 34].
